history.content:
This is the sort of question you should send to cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu. But the answer is no. 169L is not a stand-alone course and will not count as an upper div for this purpose. Econ 100A and 118 will also not count as upper divs for the CS minor unless they are crosslisted with CS and I'm not aware of this...

Classes that count as tech electives will not work as upper div courses for the minors unless they are also EE/CS courses.

I intend to minor CS and I know besides cs61abc and 70, we also need to take the other 3 upper-division classes. I found next semester(2022 spring) offering CS169L with 2 units. I wonder does this class also can be counted as one upper class? 

One more question: I have already taken Econ100A(tech elective) and Econ C118(tech elective), can any of one or both can overlap one upper-div class? (that means I only need 2 upper-division classes with CS61abc, 70 to finish my minor.) 

Thanks in advance!
history.subject: 2units class for minor?
